title: The Luggage That Outlasted My Marriage
sub_head: For nearly 20 years, she shared her husband’s Dakine luggage. They went their separate ways, but the bags power on.
body:
For the Baggage Claim series, seasoned travelers unpack their devotion to a favorite piece of luggage or travel accessory.
THE LUGGAGE and adventure-sport brand Dakine was born on Maui in 1979, when surfer-builder-tinkerer Rob Kaplan started making surf leashes meant to be indestructible. In 1986 Dakine had moved to windsurfing-central in Hood River, Ore., and begun years of expansion into bike and snow sports, apparel and more. I discovered the brand nearly 20 years ago, when my then-boyfriend, who had a great eye for accessories, bought himself a Dakine snowboarding bag and matching rolly suitcase in a retro brown-plaid pattern. (The closest match today is the “Status Roller 42L” suitcase and ski bag. The plaid is long gone but romantics can opt for the “Solstice Floral.”) Back then, we were a snowboarder/skier duo, based in Europe, hitting Courchevel, Zermatt, Chamonix.
